sentences: Michael Blum (born May 30, 1993) is an American record producer, singer, songwriter and guitarist.
In 2020, he was named an inaugural recipient of ASCAP's Peggy Lee Songwriter Award, and he was named the "Rising Star" guitarist in the 63rd Annual Critics Poll in DownBeat magazine.
Life and career ==
Early life ===
Blum was born in Great Neck, New York to a musical family.
His father, a classical guitarist, was his first music teacher.
Blum began his music studies on piano, then played saxophone before ultimately studying guitar at age nine.

sentences: In 2011, Blum began studying at Dartmouth College, from which he graduated with a double major in music and cognitive science.

sentences: During the summer of his freshman year, Blum worked as a pit musician at the New London Barn Playhouse, where he decided to pursue music professionally.

sentences: In February 2014, Blum released his debut jazz album, Initiation, with his quartet, which features bassist Jim Stinnett, pianist Brad Smith and drummer Dom Moio.

sentences: === 2019-present =
In March 2019, Blum announced that he had begun a new solo project with his single "Taking You Back".

Later that year, Blum released the second single from his solo project, "Promises," a self-produced up-tempo track inspired by uncertainty in his life., and "Save Me," an up-tempo track inspired by Blum's personal battles with anxiety.
Later in 2019, Blum moved to Los Angeles, CA and began co-writing and producing singles for artists including WESLEY, Jenna Lotti, Jake Clark, Michelle Ray, Sophie Ann and more.
